meanings.definition: To print or type in italic typeface.
meanings.sent1: She *italicized* the title of the book.
meanings.sent2: Please *italicize* the important information in your report.
meanings.sent3: The teacher *italicized* the word 'important' to make it stand out.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was so elegant that it looked like every word was *italicized*.
meanings.sent5: The *italicized* words on the page caught her attention immediately.

meanings.definition: To emphasize or highlight a word or phrase by using italic typeface.
meanings.sent1: He always *italicizes* the key points in his presentations.
meanings.sent2: You can easily *italicize* text in a word processing program.
meanings.sent3: She *italicized* the word 'warning' to make sure they noticed it.
meanings.sent4: The author's use of *italicized* words added depth to the story.
meanings.sent5: The *italicized* quote at the beginning of the chapter set the tone for the entire book.
